isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - ENGINE, REPLACE WITH SERVICE ENGINE (V8-AUTO)

wtsproc.config: Vehicle has hydraulic brakes and NAVPAC computer. Radiator assembly includes: radiator, charge air cooler and shroud.

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Disconnect battery.
Remove front bumper.
Remove air filter assembly with pipe; include disconnect IAT sensor.
Disconnect wiring harness at computer.
Remove computer from support bracket.

Disconnect all hoses, fuel lines, wire harness and glow plug relay connected to computer support bracket. Remove computer support bracket. NOTE: The computer may be removed with the computer support bracket as a unit.
Remove hood; include disconnect wire harness and cable / spring. Remove hood hinge pins.
Drain cooling system.
Evacuate A/C system (if applicable).
Remove charge air cooler pipes / hoses.

Remove left side hood hinge bracket and radiator support strut bracket from radiator frame. Remove power steering reservoir from side of radiator frame. Secure reservoir out of way for access. NOTE: do not open power steering system.
Disconnect all coolant hoses necessary to remove radiator assembly.
Disconnect both A/C lines at air conditioning compressor; include A/C line at A/C dryer and A/C low pressure line at expansion valve (if applicable).
Remove upper radiator support strut rods and right side lower radiator support strut rod.
Install lifting device to radiator assembly. Tilt radiator assembly forward for access to engine fan.
Remove fan / clutch assembly from engine using special tools.
Disconnect transmission oil cooler lines at radiator. Cap ends.
Remove lower radiator support nut. Remove radiator assembly.
Remove serpentine belt.
Disconnect wiring from alternator.
Remove bolts retaining bracket supporting A/C compressor, alternator and belt tensioner. Remove bracket with components attached as an assembly.
Disconnect all support clamps retaining main wire harness at top of engine area.
Disconnect wiring at starter. Reposition main harness and secure out of way for access.
Disconnect map sensor. Remove air intake y - pipe. Cap open ports.
Siphon oil from high pressure oil pump reservoir.
Disconnect high pressure oil pump line at left cylinder head for access to power steering pump.
Remove power steering pump, include disconnect hoses from support brackets. Reposition pump and secure. NOTE: Do not open system.
Disconnect fuel line support brackets, include disconnect fuel lines at fuel filter assembly. Reposition lines out of way and secure.
Disconnect all heater hoses and surge tank hose from engine. Secure out of way.
Disconnect exhaust pipe at turbocharger. Secure out of way.
Disconnect transmission oil fill / dipstick from engine.
Disconnect chassis wire harness support clamp at rear of left cylinder head.
Raise vehicle, support vehicle with wood block under tires.
Disconnect block heater wiring at block heater.
Disconnect all transmission oil cooler support brackets at engine. Secure out of way.
Remove front section of drive shaft.
Remove transmission oil cooler line support brackets at transmission bell housing.
Remove flywheel inspection plate. Remove bolts retaining torque converter to flywheel flex plate.
Remove rear engine support mount through bolts.
Remove all bolts except 3 retaining transmission to engine.
Install and secure transmission jack to transmission.
Remove remaining 3 bolts retaining transmission to engine. Move transmission rearward from engine to gain needed clearance. Leave transmission on jack.
Remove front engine mount nut.
Install over head lifting device to engine.
Partially remove engine and remove ground strap from left rear of engine. Remove engine from vehicle.
Place engine on floor stands. NOTE: Have replacement engine on stands, ready to transfer parts.
Transfer starter and ground strap.
Transfer thermostat / housing. Use new gasket.
Transfer all fittings, include block heater unit. NOTE: Clean threads and apply sealant to threads.
Remove transmission adapter housing first, in order to transfer flywheel / flex plate.
Transfer flywheel and flywheel flex plate. Torque bolts to spec. Install transmission adapter housing.
Transfer guide dowel pin from crankshaft (if applicable).
Remove water filter and transfer front engine mount. Torque bolts to spec. Replace water and oil filter. NOTE: Both engines will need to be raised / lowered. Fill new oil filter with oil.
Transfer rear engine mounts. Torque bolts to spec.
Drain engine oil from old engine.
Fill new engine with oil to proper level.
Install lifting device to replacement engine.
Partially install engine in position. Install engine ground strap. Complete the installation of the engine to the engine mounts.
Install engine mount bolts / nuts. Torque to spec. Remove lifting device.
Install transmission to engine. Secure transmission to engine. Remove transmission jack.
Install bolts retaining torque converter to flywheel flex plate.
Install flywheel inspection plate.
Connect transmission oil cooler lines to support brackets.
Install drive shaft. Torque bolts to spec.
Connect block heater wiring.
Connect chassis wire harness to left rear side of cylinder head.
Connect transmission oil fill tube / dipstick tube to engine.
Connect exhaust pipe to turbocharger.
Connect all heater hoses and surge tank hose to engine.
Connect all fuel lines.
Install power steering pump with new gasket. Secure power steering hoses to support brackets.
Connect high pressure oil pump line to left cylinder head.
Install air intake y-pipe.
Connect wiring to starter.
Connect wiring to map sensor. Connect main wire harness to engine support clamps.
Remove wood blocks. Lower vehicle.
Install bracket supporting A/C compressor, alternator and belt tensioner. Torque bolts to spec.
Connect wiring to alternator.
Install serpentine belt.
Place radiator assembly in position using lifting device. Install lower radiator support nut. Do not tighten at this time.
Install fan / clutch assembly using special tools.
Install upper and lower right side radiator support struts.
Remove lifting device from radiator assembly.
Tighten lower radiator nut.
Connect transmission oil cooler lines to radiator.
Connect all A/C lines (if applicable).
Connect all coolant lines to radiator.
Install power steering reservoir to radiator frame. Install left side hood hinge bracket.
Install charge air cooler pipes / hoses.
Install computer support bracket base mounts to valve cover.
Install computer support bracket. Connect glow plug relay, hoses, fuel lines and wire harness to computer support bracket.
Install computer. Torque bolts to spec.
Connect wiring to computer. Torque to spec.
Install air filter assembly with pipe. Connect wiring to IAT sensor.
Fill cooling system.
Charge A/C system (if applicable).
Install hood; include hood hinge pins, cables and wire harness.
Install front bumper.
Connect battery.
Start engine. Check engine operation. Check for fluid leaks.
Remove wheel chocks. Road test vehicle.
